div1.p: IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT, IN AND FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON, SOUTHERN DIVISION.
Ex Parte In the Matter of Leroy Smith for Writ of Habeas Corpus. AFFIDAVIT OF PETITIONER 3445
STATE OF WASHINGTON COUNTY OF PIERCE } ss.

LEROY SMITH, being first duly sworn, on oath deposes and says: That he is the above named petitioner; that he is without the means to pay the fees or necessary costs of court in this action; that he is without means to pay for the printing of briefs in support of his petition for a writ of habeas corpus; that your petitioner is a native-born citizen of the United States and is entitled to all the rights accorded to him under the forma pauperis act of June 25th, 1910. (36th Stat. 86)

WHEREFORE, your petitioner prays: 1. For an order of court that he may appear in this action in forma pauperis. 2. That he may file a typewritten etition and brief in support thereof; that the necessary fees and costs of court be paid by the Government. 3. That the court make any further order that it may deem necessary to afford your petitioner full and adequate relief.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 24th day of August, 1916. Neel G. Heuly Notary Public in and for the State of Washington, residing at U.S. Pen
IN THE SUPERIOR COURT U.S. DISTRICT COURT WESTERN DISTRICT, SOUTHERN DIVISION.
EX PARTEIN THE MATTER OF LEORY SMITH FOR WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS.
FILED IN THE U.S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington, Northern Division OCT 16 1916 FRANK L. CROSBY, Clerk, By Ed M Lakin Deputy
BEELER & SULLIVAN Lawyers 310-11 White Building, Seattle, Wash. Main 907.
